title: [Large-Scale] Christianity and Colonialism: Critical Reading and Complex Thinking Project

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory understanding of religious studies and colonial history
context.additional_context: Part of a corporate social responsibility education program, aiming to enhance multicultural understanding.

learning_goals: Students can compare and evaluate five or more scholarly perspectives analyzing the relationship between Christianity and colonialism.
Learners can write reports identifying contradictory claims across texts and proposing comprehensive interpretations.
Participants can propose practical solutions by applying historical cases to modern societal issues through digital storyboards (created via smartphones).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
